Description: Rim sherd of Chian, possibly Type A, pottery kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in faded added white outline and added red centre; exterior: slip partly worn; painted decoration consisting of sphinx (part of head remaining) to right.
Curator's comments: the placement of the sphinx immediately below the rim suggests that there may have been two friezes on the exterior of the vase. Type A kantharoi have two friezes depicted on them. For other examples, see British Museum 1888,0601.474.k and 1888,0601.474.u.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1658) (phase 2)
